, Călăraşi is a city of about 70000 people located in south eastern Romania near the
There are buses every 30-60 minutes from
(2 1/2 hours travel time) and multiple buses from
(also 2 1/2 hours away). Most of their schedules are available on

The city is reached by several local trains from Ciulniţa junction on the nearby Bucharest-Constanţa mainline (a 30 minutes trip). There is also one direct train from Bucharest ( 3 1/2 hours travel time) and one from Constanta (over 3 1/2 hours away). Timetables can be found on the railway operator's CFR website
There are ferrys across the Danube to/from the village Ostrov every 15 minutes during the day and every 30 minutes at night; the docking area at Ostrov is on the outskirts of the
, right next to the border crossing point (a separate, direct ferry to Silistra used to exist, but it's no longer running).
Several bus lines cover the city.

There are several beaches near the city and the nearby islands/marshes along the Danube are a great fishing area.
directions=right outside the city on the road to the former ferry crossing to Silistra
